description: H2WW Design System - AI Learning Interface Components based on Human-AI Interaction Research & Bauhaus Principles

research_basis.conversational_design: Addresses blank page, iteration, input-output, scoping, and personalization challenges
research_basis.obviousness_principle: Leverages existing user mental models for intuitive AI interactions
research_basis.multimodal_support: Supports visual, textual, and progressive disclosure patterns
research_basis.beyond_conversational: Integrated, contextual, & multimodal AI interfaces that move beyond text-only interaction
research_basis.contextual_intelligence: Interfaces that understand user intent and provide clear system state signifiers
research_basis.efficiency_principle: Interactions remain outside input fields when words are less efficient
research_basis.polyadic_interaction: Supports complex human-human-AI social dynamics beyond simple transactional exchanges
research_basis.ethical_boundaries: Respects social boundaries and privacy in multi-party AI conversations
research_basis.trust_mechanisms: Built-in trust-building and disclosure mechanisms for ethical AI interaction
research_basis.privacy_harm_prevention: Implements comprehensive framework addressing 18 privacy harms and risks in conversational AI
research_basis.conversation_context_awareness: Adapts interaction patterns based on relationship stages and conversation purposes
research_basis.functional_trust_model: Emphasizes security, privacy, and transparency over emotional bonding in AI interactions
research_basis.transactional_conversation_design: Prioritizes task-oriented dialogue patterns suitable for human-AI interaction
